    • testCancelSelect

    • testConnectionCloseEventualClientDisconnect

      @Test public void testConnectionCloseEventualClientDisconnect() throws Exception
      Tests a non-blocking server setup where a client connects, sends "Hello" to the server and then disconnects after the server has received the message. In the selection loop, after the client has disconnected, the server should see that the corresponding SelectionKey is "readable" (even if that means the connection was closed).
      Throws:
      Exception - on error.

    • testConnectionCloseImmediateClientDisconnect

      @Test public void testConnectionCloseImmediateClientDisconnect() throws Exception
      Tests a non-blocking server setup where a client connects, sends "Hello" to the server and then immediately disconnects. Unlike testConnectionCloseEventualClientDisconnect(), this may uncover additional faults, such as an unexpected exception when trying to read the socket name.
      Throws:
      Exception - on error.

    • testConnectionCloseEventualClientDisconnectKeepLooping

      @Test public void testConnectionCloseEventualClientDisconnectKeepLooping() throws Exception
      Tests a non-blocking server setup where a client connects, sends "Hello" to the server and then disconnects after the server has received the message. In the selection loop, after the client has disconnected, the server should see that the corresponding SelectionKey is "readable" (even if that means the connection was closed).
      Throws:
      Exception - on error.

    • testConnectionCloseImmediateClientDisconnectKeepLooping

      @Test public void testConnectionCloseImmediateClientDisconnectKeepLooping() throws Exception
      Tests a non-blocking server setup where a client connects, sends "Hello" to the server and then immediately disconnects. Unlike testConnectionCloseEventualClientDisconnect(), this may uncover additional faults, such as an unexpected exception when trying to read the socket name.
      Throws:
      Exception - on error.
